title: Broccoli and mixed mushrooms in garlic black bean sauce
time: Takes 15 minutes to make, 8 minutes to cook
description: A quick, full-flavoured vegetarian chinese stir-fry recipe of broccoli and mushrooms in black bean sauce.
ingredients: 1cm piece fresh ginger, sliced into matchsticks
1 tbsp cornflour mixed with 2 tbsp water
1 tbsp fermented salted black beans, rinsed well
1 medium red chilli, deseeded and chopped

method.Step 1: Put all the ingredients for the garlic black bean sauce in a food processor and blitz briefly. Don’t process to a smooth paste – you want to keep some texture.

method.Step 2: Heat a wok over high heat and add the oil. When it smokes, add the ginger and stir-fry for a few seconds. Add the broccoli and stir-fry for a further 1-2 minutes. Add a few small dashes of water (if you have a wok with a lid, put the lid on now to create some steam to cook the broccoli).

method.Step 3: Add the oyster and shiitake mushrooms and stir gently, taking care not to break them up. Add the black bean sauce and hot vegetable stock, and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2-3 minutes until tender. Season with light soy sauce, to taste. Add the blended cornflour paste and cook to thicken for a minute, then serve immediately.
